page.title: 09Farming in Ferryhill
page.content: Yesterday we visited East Roughlea Farm(June 1985). The farmer showed us the manure spreader.There were metal poles and a chain.The manure is put between the poles and when it moves the chain pulls the manure.At the end are blades which cut the manure before it goes in the ground. He showed us his seed spreader.There was a big container where the seeds are stacked.We could not touch the seed because it had insect killer on. The seed comes out of the bottom of the container.He has a special rake which fixes onto his tractor to push the seeds into the ground. He has a combined harvester.It cuts the corn and seperates the grain from the stalks.
